reg_info.full_title: O. Reg. 139/20: ORDER UNDER SUBSECTION 7.0.2 (4) OF THE ACT - CHILD CARE FEES
reg_info.reg_name_text: ORDER UNDER SUBSECTION 7.0.2 (4) OF THE ACT - CHILD CARE FEES
reg_info.act_under: Emergency Management and Civil Protection Act

content.content: 1. No person shall charge a fee for the provision of child care within the meaning of the Child Care and Early Years Act, 2014 unless, i. Ontario Regulation 82/20 (Order Under Subsection 7.0.2 (4) — Closure of Places of Non-Essential Businesses) made under the Act provides that the person may provide child care, and, ii. the person is providing child care.
content.raw_html:
1. No person shall charge a fee for the provision of child care within the meaning of the Child Care and Early Years Act, 2014 unless,

i. Ontario Regulation 82/20 (Order Under Subsection 7.0.2 (4) — Closure of Places of Non-Essential Businesses) made under the Act provides that the person may provide child care, and,

ii. the person is providing child care.

content.content: 2. A child care provider, within the meaning of the Child Care and Early Years Act, 2014, whose premises are closed during the declared emergency, shall not, upon reopening, penalize any person who did not pay fees to the provider while they are closed.
content.raw_html: 2. A child care provider, within the meaning of the Child Care and Early Years Act, 2014, whose premises are closed during the declared emergency, shall not, upon reopening, penalize any person who did not pay fees to the provider while they are closed.

content.content: 3. A child care provider, within the meaning of the Child Care and Early Years Act, 2014, who is authorized to provide child care during the declared emergency and whose premises are open during the declared emergency shall not penalize any person who withdraws their child from the provider’s care while they are open during the emergency period. O. Reg. 139/20, Sched. 1; O. Reg. 206/20, s. 1.  Français
content.raw_html:
3. A child care provider, within the meaning of the Child Care and Early Years Act, 2014, who is authorized to provide child care during the declared emergency and whose premises are open during the declared emergency shall not penalize any person who withdraws their child from the provider’s care while they are open during the emergency period.

O. Reg. 139/20, Sched. 1; O. Reg. 206/20, s. 1.

 

Français
